Articles.Content:
Watch all yesterday while nothing happened, then effing missed it today

I thought of it about half 11, but then got caught up in my work and forgot, then checked BBC news a few minutes after launch.

But I don't have flash installed on my office PC anyway, and I probably took it off for a reason (likely performance), so bleh.
OMFG I missed the whole launch! man I'm pissed!

Apparently I wasn't the only one. I was so passed too. I was on NASA's TV websites, which I thought would have been solid. I guess u should have gone directly to ustream's site.

Yeah maybe you are right, but the ustream stream was stuttering the whole time before, so i went with nasatv.

But look on twitter, there are many many other cases where this happened. Such a thing shouldn't happen in such a moment. But hey it launched successfully, so everything is fine. Congrats, NASA!
it is going so well, you didn't miss anything
I guess I'll catch the re-entry at least. Splashdown's expected at 16:30 UTC, when should I tune in so I'm watching from before atmospheric entry starts?

Apparently I wasn't the only one. I was so passed too. I was on NASA's TV websites, which I thought would have been solid. I guess u should have gone directly to ustream's site.

yeah NASA TV really phoned it in on this one. its back up now thou. (thanks for the emergency ustream link Themorris!)
Will they record the reentry with external cams?

I guess everyone wanted to see just the launch, not to listen to the entire talk before... damn I'm dissapointed, really wanted to see the launch :'(

Edit: Anyone wanna bet it's gonna cut off again at engine restart?
haha, they just talked about it doing a "BBQ roll" lol, didn't know that was the term!

OMFG I missed the whole launch! man I'm pissed!

Same! Was just about to sleep. I'll have to watch the video in the morning.
Any ideas on the time of splashdown?
Ooh, barbecue?!
Sorry to hear it cut out for you guys. Working fine on NASA public ustream. It was on a few TV channels too.

haha, they just talked about it doing a "BBQ roll" lol, didn't know that was the term!

lol , of course only unmanned craft get to do that because the astronaughts would go dizzy

Apparently I wasn't the only one. I was so passed too. I was on NASA's TV websites, which I thought would have been solid. I guess u should have gone directly to ustream's site.

Twitter is really irate. "Someday men will walk on Mars... and a few years later, the NASA TV stream will be dependable." - Pedro_G

Anyways, the burn is continuing without incident, and I'm looking forwards to seeing a good solid orbit established!

[EDIT: SECO! Nice!]

Same! Was just about to sleep. I'll have to watch the video in the morning.

So annoying. But at least she's up and working "perfectly"!

Anyone got any links for the recording of the live stream for us poor suckers who missed it?

EDIT

Twitter is really irate. "Someday men will walk on Mars... and a few years later, the NASA TV stream will be dependable." - Pedro_G

snip*

Lol, so true.

So... am I the only one that notices the telemetry graphic they show looks disturbingly like Kerbal Space Program? Did Jeb sneak into Orion prior to launch?

Also, loving the live streaming video from the Orion capsule itself.
oooo launch replays being shown now
Nice launch. Good onboard video. Happy camper!
I got concerned when I saw a huge verical wall of fire surround the Delta 4 when it was like 6 seconds to go :/
Ustream is doing a replay now, looks like
I missed the launch. I just got up.

We interrupt this program to bring you an important update. Jebediah Kerman just announced that, due to sheer joy and excitement at the success of the launch, he just stepped out of the hatch and went on an early EVA...
Dammit, 20 minutes late for the launch. If I'd just got a bus 3 minutes earlier...
Does anyone know what all the sparks pouring out during late stage 1 were?
